com.client.core.datatables.model.configuration.table

Interface TableConfiguration<T,ID>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the entity, for example a JpaEntity
    ID - the unique identifier of the entity, for the example the primary key of the JpaEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardTableConfiguration

    public interface TableConfiguration<T,ID>
    Contains the configuration for one DataTable

    • Method Summary

      • getDataTablesService

        DataTablesService<T,ID> getDataTablesService()
        The DataTablesService that is used by the AbstractDataTablesController
        Returns:
        Returns the DataTablesService used for this DataTable

      • setDataTablesService

        Parameters:
        dataTablesService -

      • getTableName

        java.lang.String getTableName()
        Returns the id used for the table on the html page
        Returns:

      • setTableName

        void setTableName(java.lang.String tableName)
        Sets the id used for the table on the html page, defaults to DefaultValues.DEFAULTDATATABLESNAME. If multiple tables are used on the same page this needs to be a unique value so that the html id for the table is unique. If multiple tables exist on the same page the simpleDataTables.jsp will need to be copied and the expression on the JSP page will need to be updated.

      • getLog

        org.apache.log4j.Logger getLog()
        Returns:
        the Logger for the implementation

        Sets the Logger for the implementation
        Parameters:
        log -

      • getEntity

        T getEntity()
        Gets an instance of T. This instance should have been set using the default constructor with all fields on the entity T blank.
        Returns:
        entity T

      • getViewName

        java.lang.String getViewName()
        The view name, most likely a jsp page that will be used for this DataTable.
        Returns:
        the name of the view.

      • setViewName

        void setViewName(java.lang.String viewName)
        The view name, most likely a jsp page that will be used for this DataTable. Will be used by the AbstractDataTablesController to determine the view.
        Parameters:
        viewName - the name of the view as a String

      • getCustomUrl

        java.lang.String getCustomUrl()
        Has to match the @RequestMapping on the controller extending AbstractDataTablesController.
        Returns:

      • setCustomUrl

        void setCustomUrl(java.lang.String customUrl)
        Has to match the @RequestMapping on the controller extending AbstractDataTablesController. This will be the url where the DataTable is access: http://localhost:8080/{customUrl}/init. The customUrl is used on the viewName.jsp to set the urls for the datatables and datatables-editable setup. See WEB-INF/jsp/dataTables/simpleDataTables.jsp
        Parameters:
        customUrl -

      • getAppSettings

        ApplicationSettings getAppSettings()
        The ApplicationSettings used to provide date format among possible other things.
        Returns:

      • setAppSettings

        Sets the ApplicationSettings used to provide date format among possible other things.
        Parameters:
        appSettings -

      • getRecordsCanBeAdded

        boolean getRecordsCanBeAdded()
        Can records be added. If true then the "Add" button will be added to view
        Returns:

      • setRecordsCanBeAdded

        void setRecordsCanBeAdded(boolean recordsCanBeAdded)
        Set to true if add entity functionality is needed.
        Parameters:
        recordsCanBeAdded -

      • getRecordsCanBeDeleted

        boolean getRecordsCanBeDeleted()

      • getDropDownFiller

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getDropDownFiller()
        Returns a map of all values used to populate drop down menus on view.
        Returns:
        a map containing the name of the drop down menu field as key and a map containing all the values for a drop down menu as the value.

      • setDropDownFiller

        void setDropDownFiller(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> dropDownFiller)
        Sets the drop down values map

        dropDownFiller -

      • getDropDownValuesFor

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDropDownValuesFor(java.lang.String key)
        Methods for handling drop down values, will return one of the maps from the dropDownFiller based on the name.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used in the dropDownFiller map
        Returns:

      • setDropDownValuesFor

        void setDropDownValuesFor(java.lang.String key,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
        Adds one record to the dropDownFiller map
        Parameters:
        key - of the record to add to the dropDownFiller
        values - a map containing "id":"value" to display in a drop down menu on the jsp page
